page.title: 14SOCIAL FUNCTIONS
page.content: The highlight of the Bodle Street year is probably the church fete held in the gardens of a local farm - very picturesque on a June afternoon. The flower show held in August is the pinnacle of the gardening year and the club dinner held in February starts off the season. You can be certain of delicious food at the Harvest Supper and the exchange of news and views with old friends. Carol singing round the village is a happy event for young and old alike. Coffee mornings, jumble sales, Christmas Fayres also play a part in the village life of both Bodle Street and Ashburnham although most of the events for Ashburnham are held outside the immediate area at Ashbournham Place.
